Hey, guys. Can you point me - are there any activity in laboratory devices management on FHIR?
@Hans Buitendijk @Eric Haas

Can you clarify more as to what you are looking for? There are various initiatives that would/could involve lab devices, while IHE has a fair amount of lab automation (using HL7 v2) in play and may already be working on creating the FHIR equivalents.

Hello!
Thanks for the help!
I thought no one else would answer and haven't seen this topic in a long time.
In our understanding, the laboratory devices managment system is an independent application that:

  • accepts orders for hardware laboratory tests (hereinafter "order")
  • selects the devices to execute the order
  • manages order execution job queues (hereinafter referred to as "task")
  • sends tasks to devices
  • gets results from devices
  • returns order results to the customer

Planned integration business processes between laboratory information system and laboratory devices managment system:

  • synchronize integration references
  • send order
  • get order results
Can you give an example of a device?

Abbot Architect 1000i, 8000i, Immunochemistry
Beckman Coulter Dxl 800, imunnochemistry
Beckman Au 680, biochemistry
Furuno CA 400, biochemistry
Yes, this is what IHE-LAW (Lab automation workflow) covers for in lab interfacing. Sometimes referred to as lab automation manager.
This is a standard Lab Information System workflow right
Are there open guidelines for interaction with the IHE-LAW on FHIR?
